title: I need some help with lag.
body:
So recently after so many new small updates or just as of recently (Ever since the update of the video/trailer with Ivern) I suddenly have been suffering much worse gameplay that's been making my games totally unfair and just a total frustration fest. 

I just came on tonight as the lag hasn't been too tremendous on practice or co-op vs AI, but my friend invites me suddenly after PMing me to a real game, I figure I had time and wanted to test the waters on the PvP front, so I accepted, and took bot lane with him as per-usual with my favorite marksman Tristana.

Now the game seemed like it was gonna go alright and smoothly. nothing really was going wrong, FPS seemed normal as well as MS, we get to lane after leash and get to the laning phase...it seemed alright awhile, but then suddenly...I got something I never had before, Tristana was literally starting to float or just lag out and move weirdly all around the battlefield, and then CSing became impossible as when I clicked it'd delay and minions would get the kill, it just got worse and worse to the point it oddly started just dead halting and flashing a flickering blue meter that read "Reconnecting"...eventually I told my pal I was gonna try to re-connect, so I did....but the green dot read LITERALLY 299...it's always been  between the 30's to 40's mark..but never anything higher...and reconnecting didn't help as when I got back it still acted up. 

Anyone know how to fix these sorta lag issues in the game? cause now I'm actually afraid to try another game in real PvP cause I don't wanna cost my friend another game :(

replies.body: It sounds like your network is suffering from some issues or packet loss, which would cause input delays and weird occurrences like this.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) for the match if you're still having this issue for an overview of what's going wrong.  The results will also provide you with a set of troubleshooting steps specific to your case.  You can test it out in a custom game to prevent penalties.  Don't be afraid, this can get fixed up!

I'm rather disappointed to inform that none of this worked, I went to the log reader and had it read my most recent match with Tristana and it basically said it was Packet loss and ping issues, all the methods basically tell you just to turn off your router and reset it basically for thirty seconds and then turn it back on, I did so and just tried to even enter a co-op vs AI as Gnar and it wouldn't even go by the loading screen now, I waited about five or ten minutes and I just had to shutdown my PC cause it was showing no signs of ever loading up and letting me into the match (Sadly I had to abandon that game, hopefully no leaver buster -.-) 

Following this actually seemed to somehow make it worse with that sort of change, I have went ahead and tried the Hextech Repair Tool and let it run through prior to resetting just to see if I could double my chances of success or anything to fix it, and that was the result it seems. I'm getting rather frustrated as this feels like the same deal that I had with my first MOBA being Smite.

Game ran perfectly for the longest time after I sunk loads of cash into it for skins and such (In this case it's been champions I wanna play that are so damn expensive and some skins here and there for my main champs) but now it's frustrating that this is suddenly popping up with issues for no reason, rest assured the computer itself runs smoothly and can watch Youtube videos at 720IP to even 1080 and can play flash games or any 3D games on the web just fine. so it's apparently something just circled around LoL right now. I need to really get it fixed ASAP or else really it's gonna be another little under 100$ if not over 100$ money pit of a game.

Thanks for the update!  The results of the logreader are super helpful because it helps us pinpoint what's going on.  In this case, it's suggesting that your network is having some big problems maintaining a connection, causing a degradation in your game stability.  Using the HRT to repair won't do much in this case because it will repair game files, not your connection.  For your specific issue, I highly suggest going through each step in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to strengthen your connection or any settings getting in the way.  

As a heads up, just because you can use the internet for Youtube doesn't mean that your network can't have problems specifically connecting to the game server.  This should get you fixed up!

I'm already hitting a rather tiny wall with the Firewall step, I tried to find it on the "Allow Programs" list and then the "Add other programs" list and couldn't find it, so I hit browse and found the only Leagues related thing I could find scouring and all it keeps giving me is the "lol.launcher" opposed to in the video it reads "League of Legends"

I'm gonna try a few more steps, I tried the total turn off of the firewall and no improvement came, but if none of this works could a total uninstall and reinstall fix this at all?
same, after the path and some small update my game can't work as before, the spike lag and disconnect happen so often

This happens on and off for me, occasional small bad lag patches but nothing, NOTHING like last night with sliding figures, delayed attacks and animations and just dead halting to read "Reconnecting". seriously it's nice and all to have new champs/skins almost weekly or such, but sometimes it grows a little tiresome for us new players who are trying to even get into the game 100% and play every champ or experience the game and get our mains up to level 5 and beyond, I understand all the veteran players are always thirsting for more new content, but sometimes there needs to be taken into consideration there's just new players like myself who wanna even dig into the many folds of champions and their different play styles -.-{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

Well I've tried many tips,tricks,solutions at this point, and I can't pinpoint a single problem that could be causing this. I've followed the many steps that were specifically named like Packet Loss, there were some yellow and red lights but none had the word "Packet Loss" or "Packet Buffering" in them, I've scoured Google, Youtube, and many sources at this point, and I officially just did an entire uninstall and reinstall. but it's only made some minor improvements, my FPS seems to be the main issue now where it starts off fine, but once minion spawn happens and I get into it, it begins to drop to 12FPS to a horrible 08-09 FPS, I've followed every step to optimize and improve gameplay, lag removal tips, and everything under the sun it feels at this point. 

I am at a point of rather frustration/disgust as I've been trying tirelessly at this and when you keep hitting walls and never seeing an inch of improvement or you feel like you're going a step in the right direction it's very tiresome. I suppose the best thing I can do at this point is just take a step back, let it sit for a couple days and come back to it with some more actual inspiration or motivation to try again. I mean as much as I miss the game right now and still have loads of champs I wanna keep pushing mastery's on (Even more worse is the bonus IP weekend I'm gonna entirely miss which I could've grinded to buy an expensive champ or one I wanted) 

I don't know if anyone can see this anymore or if anyone is still listening, but for those who may come by this or happen to read it. this is the current status.
